intro: Corydalis emanueli, commonly known as Emmanuel's fumitory, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically range in color from pink to purple. The plant produces small, oval-shaped leaves and has a creeping growth habit, often forming dense mats. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and rarity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
